channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Billy Bean, second openly gay ex-MLB player, dies at 60
item.description: Bean, who became the second former Major League Baseball player to come out as gay in 1999 before becoming the sport’s senior vice president for diversity, equity and inclusion, has died. He was 60.
item.content:encoded:
Bean, who became the second former Major League Baseball player to come out as gay in 1999 before becoming the sport’s senior vice president for diversity, equity and inclusion, has died. He was 60.

(Image credit: Chris O'Meara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Harris introduces her running mate, 'Coach Walz,' at an energetic Philly rally
item.description: In Philadelphia, Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris introduced her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, ticking through his varied resume.
item.content:encoded:
In Philadelphia, Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris introduced her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, ticking through his varied resume.

(Image credit: Joe Lamberti)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis is breaking records at the Olympics
item.description: Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis soared roughly a foot higher than the silver and bronze medalists. And he kept setting the bar higher, breaking the world record.
item.content:encoded: Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis soared roughly a foot higher than the silver and bronze medalists. And he kept setting the bar higher, breaking the world record.
item.dc:creator: Gus Contreras

item.title: Harris takes a slight national lead over Trump in new poll
item.description: To take a measure of where the election stands, we have a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll out Tuesday that shows Vice President Harris gaining a slight lead nationally on former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded: To take a measure of where the election stands, we have a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll out Tuesday that shows Vice President Harris gaining a slight lead nationally on former President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: How does space change the human body? The answer will shapes future missions
item.description: Space X’s highly anticipated Polaris Dawn mission is set to launch later this summer – with an all-civilian crew. And a big part of their mission is researching how space changes the human body.
item.content:encoded: Space X’s highly anticipated Polaris Dawn mission is set to launch later this summer – with an all-civilian crew. And a big part of their mission is researching how space changes the human body.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: A former DACA recipient, Cindy Nava is running for public office in New Mexico
item.description: Cindy Nava could become one of the first former DACA recipients to win during a general election in the U.S. She already won the primary race earlier this year for a state senate seat in New Mexico.
item.content:encoded: Cindy Nava could become one of the first former DACA recipients to win during a general election in the U.S. She already won the primary race earlier this year for a state senate seat in New Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Velazquez

item.title: Debby is expected to continue drenching eastern South Carolina
item.description: While Florida is cleaning up from Hurricane Debby, the storm is still dumping record amounts of rain onto Coastal Georgia and South Carolina.
item.content:encoded: While Florida is cleaning up from Hurricane Debby, the storm is still dumping record amounts of rain onto Coastal Georgia and South Carolina.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Algeria's Imane Khelif, ensnared in political controversy, will box for Olympic gold
item.description: A boxing federation claims Khelif failed two unspecified gender tests in recent years. Olympic officials say the tests were illegitimate. Khelif will face China's Yang Liu in Friday's gold medal bout.
item.content:encoded:
A boxing federation claims Khelif failed two unspecified gender tests in recent years. Olympic officials say the tests were illegitimate. Khelif will face China's Yang Liu in Friday's gold medal bout.

(Image credit: Matthew Stockman)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: The U.K.’s far right has stirred violent, racist attacks in British cities
item.description: In several British cities over the past week, racist mobs have attacked mosques, hotels housing immigrants — or anyone of color. The riots that have been enflamed by misinformation online.
item.content:encoded: In several British cities over the past week, racist mobs have attacked mosques, hotels housing immigrants — or anyone of color. The riots that have been enflamed by misinformation online.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Protests Force Bangladesh's Longest-Serving Prime Minister to Flee
item.description: This week the prime minister of Bangladesh fled the country by helicopter, forced out by a protest movement that started peacefully but became violent. We hear from our correspondent about the events that lead to this dramatic change in government. And we hear reaction from a journalist who had been jailed 6 years ago for criticizing that government.
item.content:encoded:
This week the prime minister of Bangladesh fled the country by helicopter, forced out by a protest movement that started peacefully but became violent. We hear from our correspondent about the events that lead to this dramatic change in government. And we hear reaction from a journalist who had been jailed 6 years ago for criticizing that government.

(Image credit: Abu Sufian Jewel)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid
